Detailed Description

The X10 base object. This provides common functionality to initialize and finalize the runtime system. An X10 object is created after MPI is initialized. One X10 object is created per MPI process.

Member Function Documentation

static void X10Runtime::X10::finalize (   )  [static]
 

Finalizer. Invoked after all X10 methods, but before MPI_Finalize().

static void X10Runtime::X10::initialize (   )  [static]
 

Initializer. Invoked before any other X10 API method is invoked.

void X10Runtime::X10::process (  Activity *  act  ) 
 

Process an activity till quiessence. This is an outer "finish", invoked collectively by all places.

Parameters:
act The activity that is the root of all activities.

am_handle_t X10Runtime::X10::registerAMHandle (  am_t  am  ) 
 

Register an active message handle. An activity can only spawn active messages. These active messages in turn spawn activites at the target place. As of now, there is no direct mechanism to spawn remote activities. I am not sure how this can be done with anything other than a design pattern/coding guideline.

Parameters:
am Function pointer to the active message handler.

Clock X10Runtime::X10::registerClock (   ) 
 

Register a clock. This is used to create a clock for the invoking activity and possibly its descendents.

FinishScope X10Runtime::X10::registerFinishScope (   ) 
 

Register a finish scope. This can be used to wait for an activity's descendents.

void X10Runtime::X10::spawn (  am_t  am,
int  nbytes,
void *  buf,
Place  target
) 
 

Spawn an active message. Spawns an active message at the target place.

Parameters:
am Function pointer to the active message handler.
nbytes The buffer size in bytes
buf The buffer whose contents form argument to am
target The place at which the active message is to be invoked.
